Dear Ms. Page-Sander:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
7/19/20. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statues and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-06H Timely entry of caseworker contacts
Page 15-16
The caseworker must enter the required face-to-face
contacts listed below in MISACWIS within five business
days of the contact. This includes attempted and missed
face-to-face contacts.
Four of eight foster care files had contacts entered in MISACWIS outside of the
required timeframe.
FOM 722-08C Foster Care PATP & Service Agreement
Page 9
When completed, obtain all signatures as appropriate,
including those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care worker,
supervisor, foster parent, caregiver, any youth age 14 and
older and in the case of placement agency foster care
cases, the local DHS office designee.
CI 17-099: When the treatment plan is completed,
signatures for all appropriate case members must be
obtained. Signatures from all appropriate case members,
including youth ages 14 and older for foster care and youth
ages 11 and older for juvenile justice, should be obtained
before the corresponding court hearing. All treatment plans
with a report date of August 1, 2017, or later must have
signatures from all appropriate case members within 30
days of the report date.
4

Three of eight foster care files had PATPs with late or missing signatures:
File one: 4/27/21 PATP not signed by parent and foster parent until 6/3/21.
File two: 5/5/21 PATP missing mom’s signature. Foster parent did not sign until
6/16/21. 11/9/20 PATP was not signed by foster parent or parent until 1/21/21.
2/4/21 PATP signed by foster parent, but not dated to show compliance with
timeframe requirement.
File three: 3/19/21 PATP signed by mom 6/25/21 and FP on 5/25/21.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Interim review dated 10/7/20; CAP approved 10/28/20.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The CAP (approved 10/28/20) was a result
of the 10/7/20 interim review. The CAP addressed violations regarding 312 Foster
parent training, 413 medical and dental care, FOM 722-08C PATP signatures, FOM
722-09 service plans, and 722-06b Family team meetings. With the exception of
timely PATP signatures, there were no repeat violations during this review period.
The agency has successfully implemented their CAP. However, staff report to
continue having difficulty getting parents to sign the PATP in a timely manner. A new
CAP will be developed to address this.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes, MISEP requirements, or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an acceptable
corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of
their regular license.
